title.rendered: ERC-3643 – The Official Smart Contract Standard for Permissioned Tokens

content.rendered:
ERC-3643

An Official Standard for Permissioned Tokens

The ERC-3643, previously known as the T-REX protocol, is an open-source suite of smart contracts that enables the issuance, management, and transfer of permissioned tokens. $28bn worth of assets have been tokenized through ERC-3643.

🎉  In September 2021, T-REX Protocol was recognized as ERC-3643

ERC-3643 In Use

120+
FUNCTIONS
180+
JURISDICTIONS ENFORCED
€8.5BN
TOKENIZED VALUE FOR CUSTOMERS
40+
TOKENS CREATED AND MANAGED
The Proven & Secure Protocol
The source code is well crafted and follows security practices compliant with the architecture described in the whitepaper.

Private Markets Lack Infrastructure

The infrastructure used in private markets consists of many disconnected and siloed service providers. Due to market fragmentation, analogue and arduous processes have been implemented to enforce trust. This lack of infrastructure leads to poor asset transferability and little to no liquidity.

Trust, Compliance and Control on a Shared Infrastructure

The ERC-3643 allows market actors to apply trust, compliance and control on a shared infrastructure and achieve enhanced transferability. Actors utilizing the ERC-3643 can unlock the tremendous benefits that come from adopting a high functioning infrastructure and improve the liquidity of securities.

ERC-3643 Benefits

ENCODE COMPLIANCE

Transfer rules are embedded in the securities

CONTROL SECURITIES

Issuers/agents control the tokens, even with investor direct ownership

REDUCE COSTS

Reduce fees with T+0 automated onchain settlement

INCREASE TRANSFERABILITY

Unlock high functioning assets and improve liquidity

Update your assets with hundreds of functions

Key Functions For Issuers/Agents

APPLY CONTROL

The issuer keeps control of the securities and can mint, burn, block or force transfers at any time

ENFORCE COMPLIANCE

Rules and responsibilities are coded into the tokens to ensure compliance across the lifecycle

HIGHLY CUSTOMIZABLE

Add additional smart contracts or upgrade the existing ones at any time

INSTRUCT 3RD PARTIES

Assign roles and permissions for market participants

EASY SERVICING

Enable automation and perform corporate actions on demand

DYNAMIC CAP TABLES

Access position and transaction reports at any time and enable automated updates

Key Functions For Investors

NON-CUSTODIAL

Fees are drastically reduced with investor self-custody

ASSESS VALUE

Investors can easily assess the value of their portfolio

RECOVERY PROCESS

Upon proof of identity, lost tokens can be recovered in a new wallet

REUSABLE IDENTITY

Validated identities can be used across multiple security offerings

DIGITAL DASHBOARD

Digital portal for investors to manage their assets after the issuance

DIRECT RELATIONSHIPS

Issuers can directly communicate with their investors, removing middlemen

How It Works

With the ERC-3643, the compliance is programmed into the security token. Transfers to ineligible investors are impossible through the fast and secure validation system.

ERC-3643 (ex T-REX) Whitepaper
Visit Github
Trusted by recognized players and government  
Trusted by recognized players and government  

FAQ

Is the ERC-3643 open source?
Is the ERC-3643 secure and audited?
How does the ERC-3643 apply compliance?
Is the ERC-3643 interoperable with the main blockchain infrastructures?
What are the differences between ERC-3643 and ERC-1400?
Why do you believe in public blockchains?

Is the ERC-3643 open source?

Yes, the ERC-3643 is open source. See the GitHub here. Tokeny provides the APIs and software to easily deploy and manage these security tokens.

Is the ERC-3643 secure and audited?

Yes, reliable companies support this standard and it has been externally audited by cybersecurity firm Kaspersky. It is the most proven protocol with years of development and evolution since 2017.

How does the ERC-3643 apply compliance?

Via the investor and offering rules that are checked in every transfer. Investor rules are enabled with BlockIDÂ® and offering rules are enforced with the compliant ERC-3643 standard. Also, there are many built-in functions to control the tokens and assign roles and permissions to different stakeholders.

Is the ERC-3643 interoperable with the main blockchain infrastructures?

Yes, ERC-3643 is ERC-20 compatible, as well as with the majority of DeFi applications.

What are the differences between ERC-3643 and ERC-1400?

The ERC-3643 manages compliance by leveraging the security of the blockchain with an automatic validator system. This system applies the transfer rules related to users (identities) and those related to the offering. The issuer of the securities, or its agent, always keeps control of the tokens and the transfers. ERC1400 is another approach where each trade must be validated by a specific key generated offchain.

Read More

Why do you believe in public blockchains?

We firmly believe the future of finance will operate on public blockchains but by applying control and compliance through permissioned tokens and onchain identities. This is exactly what the ERC-3643 is providing. Private blockchains will struggle to progress because they defeat the purpose of what blockchain was set out to do in terms of removing fragmentation.

CONTACT OUR EXPERTS

Modernize your securities with the leading security token standard via ready-to-use API and software

Contact UsCheck our products
